article.title: GT version Migrating Guide for Non-WS A&A
article.para: The following provides available information about migrating from previous versions of the Globus Toolkit.

section.title: Migrating GSI from GT2
section.para: Nothing should have to be done when migrating from GT2.

section.title: GAA and authorization callout configuration
section.para: GT 3 introduced the notion of authorization callouts. These callouts are configured via configuration files discovered as described in . When installing GT4 on a system on which these configuration files already exist, it is important to either update them for GT4 (since these files contain version specific informations) or to remove them from any of the locations in which GT4 is looking for these configuration files.

note.simpara: If you plan to use GT3 and GT4 on the same system, you will need to short circuit the search algorithm for these configuration files by specifying the correct location for these files via the GSI_AUTHZ_CONF and GSI_GAA_CONF environment variables.
